required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tryton Post Approval Study (PAS) for the Tryton Side Branch Stent
clinical_study.official_title: Tryton Post Approval Study (PAS) for the Tryton Side Branch Stent

brief_summary.textblock: TRYTON Post Approval Study (PAS) of the Tryton Side Branch Stent

detailed_description.textblock: The primary objective of this PAS is to assure the continued safety and effectiveness of the Tryton Side Branch Stent™ with main branch approved DES in the treatment of de novo native coronary artery bifurcation lesions with side branch diameter ranging from ≥2.5 mm to ≤3.5 mm and main branch diameter ranging from ≥2.5 mm to ≤4.0 mm.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Prospective, single arm open label registry

primary_outcome.description: Composite of cardiac death, target vessel MI (Q and non-Qwave) clinically driven target vessel revascularization

secondary_outcome.description: Attainment of <30% residual stenosis within the side branch without device malfunction
Attainment of <30% residual stenosis using any percutaneous method
Lesion success without the occurrence of in-hospital MACE
ARC definition of definite and probable

arm_group.description: Coronary artery stenting of De novo bifurcation lesions MB & SB

intervention.description: Interventional coronary artery stent placement in De novo bifurcation lesions of the MB & SB
